World.headline: India Reiterates Support for Gaza Peace Plan
World.summary: India has once again affirmed its backing for a peace plan concerning Gaza, emphasizing the need for stability and resolution in the conflict-ridden region. This stance highlights India's ongoing commitment to international efforts for de-escalation and humanitarian aid.
key_points: India supports the Gaza peace plan.
Emphasis on stability and resolution in the region.
Highlights India's commitment to international de-escalation.

World.headline: At Least 20 People Killed, Over 300 Injured in Earthquake in Afghanistan
World.summary: A powerful earthquake has struck Afghanistan, resulting in the deaths of at least 20 people and injuring over 300. The natural disaster caused significant destruction to buildings, further exacerbating the humanitarian crisis in the country.
key_points: Major earthquake hits Afghanistan.
At least 20 fatalities and over 300 injured reported.
Significant destruction to buildings, worsening humanitarian situation.

World.headline: NYC Mayoral Race: Trump Threatens to Cut Federal Funds If Mamdani Wins Election
World.summary: Donald Trump has warned he will cut federal funds to New York City if Zohran Mamdani, whom he labeled a "communist," wins the mayoral election. This threat introduces significant political tension and potential financial repercussions for the city.
key_points: Trump threatens to cut federal funds to NYC.
Contingent on Zohran Mamdani winning the mayoral election.
Highlights political polarization and potential financial impact on the city.

World.headline: US Shutdown: Trump Admin to Pay Half of Food Stamp Benefits
World.summary: The Trump administration announced it would only pay half of the scheduled food stamp benefits due to the ongoing government shutdown. This decision raises concerns about food security for millions of low-income families reliant on the SNAP program.
key_points: Trump administration will pay only half of food stamp benefits.
Decision is due to the ongoing government shutdown.
Raises concerns for food security among low-income families.

World.headline: Ukraine Gets More Patriot Defence Systems to Counter Russian Attacks
World.summary: Ukraine is receiving additional Patriot air defence systems to bolster its capabilities against ongoing Russian aerial assaults. This aid aims to strengthen the country's defense infrastructure and protect its cities from missile and drone strikes.
key_points: Ukraine receives more Patriot air defence systems.
Aims to strengthen defenses against Russian aerial attacks.
Will help protect Ukrainian cities from missiles and drones.

Business.headline: Bharti Airtel Q2 Results: Profit More Than Doubles to Rs 8,651 Crore
Business.summary: Bharti Airtel announced a staggering Q2 profit of Rs 8,651 crore, more than doubling its previous figures, driven by increased Average Revenue Per User (ARPU). This strong performance outpaces rival Jio, signaling a robust growth trajectory for the telecom giant.
key_points: Bharti Airtel's Q2 profit surged to Rs 8,651 crore.
Profit more than doubled, driven by higher ARPU.
Outperformed rival Jio, showing strong growth.

Business.headline: OpenAI Seals $38 Billion Deal with Amazon for AI Computing Power
Business.summary: OpenAI has finalized a substantial $38 billion deal with Amazon for AI computing power, a move that potentially signals the end of its exclusive reliance on Microsoft. This partnership is set to significantly enhance OpenAI's computational capabilities for advanced AI development.
key_points: OpenAI secured a $38 billion deal with Amazon for AI computing.
The partnership may end OpenAI's exclusive reliance on Microsoft.
Aims to significantly enhance OpenAI's advanced AI development capabilities.

Business.headline: Will Scrap Adani Power Deal If Graft Is Proved: Bangladesh
Business.summary: Bangladesh has stated it will scrap its power deal with Adani if allegations of corruption are substantiated, placing scrutiny on the controversial project. This development could have significant implications for bilateral energy cooperation and investor confidence.
key_points: Bangladesh threatens to cancel its power deal with Adani.
Cancellation contingent on proving corruption allegations.
Could impact bilateral energy cooperation and investor confidence.

key_points: India leads efforts for a global ethical AI framework.

key_points: Tesla shareholders to vote on Elon Musk's pay package.
The vote could impact Musk's control and ownership stake.
Crucial for the future direction of the electric vehicle company.

key_points: India's total tree count is increasing.
However, the health and strength of trees are declining.
Highlights environmental stress on forest ecosystems and biodiversity.

key_points: Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object, baffles scientists.
Exhibits unusual characteristics and trajectory.
Researchers are studying its composition and interstellar origins.

The moon will appear larger and brighter due to closer proximity.

Health.headline: What a Dark Neck Patch Tells Us About India’s Child Obesity Crisis
Health.summary: A dark patch on the neck, often mistaken for dirt, can be a significant indicator of insulin resistance and a deeper child obesity crisis in India. This symptom highlights an urgent public health concern requiring early detection and intervention strategies.
key_points: Dark neck patches can indicate insulin resistance.
A significant symptom of India's child obesity crisis.
Highlights the urgent need for early detection and intervention.

Health.headline: Just 5 Extra Minutes of Scrolling on the Toilet Can Raise Disease Risk by 46%
Health.summary: A new study warns that spending just five extra minutes scrolling on the toilet can significantly increase the risk of certain diseases by 46%. Prolonged sitting and poor posture during this activity are linked to various health issues.
key_points: 5 extra minutes of toilet scrolling increases disease risk by 46%.
Linked to prolonged sitting and poor posture.
Warns against certain hygiene habits and their health implications.

Health.headline: 12 OD Deaths in India Every Week: NCRB Report

key_points: NCRB reports 12 overdose deaths weekly in India.
Highlights a severe public health challenge related to drug abuse.
Underscores the urgent need for prevention and treatment programs.

Health.headline: Blood Test for Prostate Cancer Cuts Risk of Dying by 13%, Study Finds
Health.summary: A new study indicates that regular prostate cancer screening via blood tests can reduce the risk of dying from the disease by 13%. This finding reinforces the importance of early detection and routine check-ups for men's health.
key_points: Regular blood tests for prostate cancer reduce death risk by 13%.
Reinforces the importance of early detection.
Highlights the value of routine check-ups for men's health.

key_points: WHO virologist warns of bird flu strain's pandemic potential.
Public health officials are closely monitoring its evolution.
